newsitem.title: GERMANY: Swissair wins German market share.
newsitem.headline: Swissair wins German market share.

text.p: Swissair said it had increased passenger sales in Germany substantially after increasing flights by 30 percent last year.
The Swiss national carrier said it was now adding new summer flights from Germany to try to win more passengers.
A spokeswoman said: "We have increased our passenger numbers massively from Germany."
But she declined to give any absolute figures on passenger numbers or market share.
Two-thirds of Swissair passengers on the 400 weekly flights from Germany were flying only to Switzerland while the rest were transit passengers, she noted.
In total, the airline said it won an extra 60,000 international transit passengers from November to January after expanding its hub system at Zurich.
Swissair now fly three times a day from Hanover to Zurich and have improved intercontinental connecting times on its evening Munich to Zurich flight, the spokeswoman said.
-- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax5017
